work.name: Inocras .Inc
work.position: Computational Genomics center – Pipeline Development team
work.summary: In my current role, I focus on `structural variant (SV) calling`, implementing and optimizing SV callers, applying mutation refinements, and enhancing sensitivity in detecting complex genomic alterations. This has led to more accurate variant identification and a reduction in SV calls by up to 78%. I also work on actionable findings in cancer genomics, integrating `The Clinical Knowledgebase (CKB)` into our somatic pipeline to improve data accessibility for actionable drugs, on-label drug recommendations, and clinical trial matching. Additionally, I lead AI-driven projects developing `deep learning-based mutation callers` to enhance mutation detection accuracy and efficiency.

education.institution: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

education.area: Double major in Computer Science & Life Science
education.studyType: B.S. - Summa cum laude, Early graduation

courses: Studied abroad for high school in the United States

publications.name: Deep learning untangles the resistance mechanism of p53 reactivator in lung cancer cells
publications.summary: Proposed a novel combinatorial target and computational method to overcome drug resistance to p53 activator in lung cancer using GAN and GNN.

Research Experience.name: Deep learning untangles the resistance mechanism of p53 reactivator in lung cancer cells
Research Experience.summary: Master Thesis & Journal publication & KOR/US patent
highlights: Problem: Though TP53 mutations in lung cancer make p53 activator treatments essential, drug resistance limits their effectiveness.

Contributions: Developed a novel computational approach using Generative adversarial networks and Graph neural networks to identify drug resistance mechanisms and therapeutic targets. Conducted in vitro validation, confirming the therapeutic potential of the identified gene targets.
Results: Identified a key biomarker linked to p53 resistance, leading to a Korean/US patent application and publication in Cell iScience.

Research Experience.name: A systems biological study to investigate the fundamental principle and overcoming method of adaptive resistance to targeted anti-cancer therapy’
highlights: Problem: Though TP53 mutations in lung cancer make p53 activator treatments essential, drug resistance limits their effectiveness.
